name: OpenAI / Microsoft
title: Partnership Restructuring + Agentic AI

classification.classificationRationale: Auto-converted from legacy phenotype 'product-venture-lab' / 'venture-builder'. Orientation inferred from content and design principles. Needs human review.

description:
The foundational AI partnership that ignited the AI boom, now restructured with clearer boundaries. OpenAI focuses on frontier models while Microsoft deploys at enterprise scale through Agent 365 and Azure.
- New MOU signed: Microsoft holds ~$135B investment (27% as-converted diluted basis)
- OpenAI remains Microsoft's frontier model partner with Azure API exclusivity until AGI
- OpenAI committed to $250B additional Azure cloud services
- Microsoft sole cloud provider allowed to sell OpenAI models until at least 2030
- OpenAI transitioning to public benefit corporation (PBC) with Microsoft support
- 2026 focus: 'Agentic AI' with Microsoft's Agent 365 suite—autonomous digital workers for procurement, HR, supply chain

observableMarkers.metrics: ChatGPT: 800M+ weekly active users, 1M+ business customers. OpenAI revenue: $2B (2023) to $20B+ (2025). Compute grew from 0.2GW to 1.9GW. Vision: ChatGPT evolving from chatbot to 'super assistant' with goals, context, and proactive help.

mechanisms.name: Deploy to Thousands Before You Know What Works
mechanisms.evidence: Identified via design principle 'rapid-iteration-cycles' in original case data. Evidence needs strengthening from sources.

layers.label: PBC Restructuring & IPO Path
layers.summary: EVOLUTION: OpenAI completed restructuring from capped-profit nonprofit subsidiary → Public Benefit Corporation ('OpenAI Group PBC') on Oct 28, 2025. Nonprofit → 'OpenAI Foundation' holds equity ~$130B, commits $25B to health/curing diseases. Microsoft holds $135B/27% equity with tech rights through 2032. SoftBank invested $40B (half conditional on lifting profit cap). Independent AGI verification panel created. On path to IPO potentially valued at $1T, H2 2026. Hired Krishna Rao (former Airbnb, key to 2020 IPO).
layers.classification: Model 5b (Venture Builder) — governance evolution, not structural model change

layers.label: Latest Update
layers.summary: Partnership frayed under pressure in 2025 as the halcyon early days ended. FTC and European Commission actively investigating for potential anti-competitive behavior. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella wants industry to stop calling AI 'slop.' OpenAI reportedly burning through vast cash to maintain AI adva...

taxonomyFeedback: [2026-02] This specimen reveals a critical boundary case for M5b classification: the 'venture' being built is actually a redefinition of organizational boundaries through contractual governance rather than internal structure. The $135B investment with explicit rights through 2032, AGI-contingent exclusivity, and mandatory Azure cloud commitment ($250B) creates a hybrid entity where OpenAI's structural autonomy is constrained by quasi-ownership rights. This is M5b without the clarity of who is the 'builder' and who is the 'venture'—a symbiotic arrangement that challenges the parent-subsidiary logic implicit in our venture builder model.

[2026-02] The PBC restructuring (Oct 2025) exposes tension between financial scaling imperatives and governance models designed for off-strategy exploration. The mechanics are striking: nonprofit holds $130B equity but OpenAI needs massive capital infusion ($40B from SoftBank, half conditional on lifting profit cap) to remain competitive. This is the opposite of Mechanism 1 (Protect Off-Strategy Work)—instead we observe how frontier model competition forces commercialization pressure backward into governance structure. The independent AGI verification panel is a fascinating institutional response: attempting to preserve mission alignment while accepting profit-maximizing capital structure.

[2026-02] The partnership's evolution from 2025-2026 ('halcyon early days ended,' FTC/EC investigations, frayed relationship) demonstrates how M5b structures face coordination costs as market position shifts. When OpenAI was uncertain, Microsoft provided patient capital and distribution; now with 800M weekly active users and $20B revenue, bargaining power rebalances. The contractual lock-in (Azure exclusivity until 2030, sole cloud provider rights) suggests Microsoft anticipated this dynamic—using formal governance to prevent the very autonomy that made OpenAI valuable. This may be a general pattern: M5b venture builders succeed themselves into coordination problems.
